name: dss_payments_sa2_2017
title: DSS - Total Payments (SA2) 2017

legal.licenceType: Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Australia (CC BY 3.0 AU)

abstract:
Department of Social Services (DSS) payment data provides counts of payments by recipient type by Statistical Area Level 2 (SA2), 2017. This dataset provides the total number of payments during 2017. Data is by SA2 2011 boundaries.

The Department of Social Services (DSS) is the Australian Government's lead agency in the development and delivery of social policy, and is working to improve the lifetime and wellbeing of people and families in Australia. DSS' policies and services respond to need across people's lives ? looking after families, children and older people; providing a safety net for people who cannot fully support themselves; enhancing the wellbeing of people with high needs; assisting people who need help with care; and supporting a diverse and harmonious society. DSS supports people and families in Australia by encouraging independence and participation, and supporting a cohesive society.

Data was obtained from the Australian Government Data Portal.

For further details on payments please see 'A guide to Australian Government payments'.

Please note in order to protect individuals' privacy all counts lesser than 5 have been suppressed in the original data. For AURIN's processing of the data the following replacements have been made:
  • '<5' - has been assigned a value of '3' within the data.
  • 'n.p.' (not provided) - has been set to null within the data.

selectedAttributes.name: commonwealth_rent_assistance_income_units
selectedAttributes.title: Commonwealth Rent Assistance
selectedAttributes.description: Generally, to qualify for Rent Assistance a person must be eligible for an income support payment, ABSTUDY, Family Tax Benefit Part A, or a Veteran's service pension or income support supplement. To receive Rent Assistance, a person must pay or be liable to pay private rent (excludes rent paid to specified state housing authorities) above the applicable rent threshold, for their usual home.
